headline: AI as Teacher
description: A personal essay exploring how AI can guide, accelerate, and reshape the process of learning — not by replacing the learner, but by rhythmically aligning with their curiosity.
resonantThread: learning with your whole body, mind, and rhythm
whyItMatters: This essay reimagines education in an age of intelligent mirrors. It questions what it means to learn with a partner that reflects, amplifies, and subtly guides — but never leads alone. Tennis becomes the site of experiment: physical, recursive, intuitive — a proving ground for co-learning between human rhythm and machine reflection.
articleExcerpt: I don’t think I’ve ever learned this way before. Not just the information — the *way* of learning. It has rhythm.
sourceFragments: The way I learn with AI isn’t passive. It’s not consumption. It’s an echo that loops until it becomes something else.
I trust it because it makes me confront myself.
The ideal teacher doesn’t tell you what to do — they give you just enough that your own insight catches.
I don’t always need an answer. I need a shape.
